<nowiki>*</nowiki>'''''linta''''' (pl. '''linte''') is a [[quenya]] word meaning "swift".
==Etymology==
The etymology is not clear, but perhaps hints to a [[Sundocarmë|Root]] *LIN or *LIT
==Examples==
{{quote|Yéni ve '''lintë''' yuldar avánier ('The years have passed like '''swift''' draughts')<ref>{{RGEO|Namarie}}, line 3</ref>|''[[Namárië]]''}}
==See also==
*''[[lintie]]''
==Cognates==
*[[Sindarin]] ?''[[lim]]''
==Inspiration==
This word is a relic from [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]'s juvenile language called [[Nevbosh]]. In that language ''lint'' means "quick, clever, nimble"<ref>''[[The Monsters and the Critics]]'' p. 205, 206</ref>
